pip.Description: Your general health state. Defines how much damage you can take before you lose consciousness and get returned to a check-point
Magical radiation sickness decreases your maximum health. RadAway can purge your body of radiation
Amount of poison in your body. You will lose health until you take an antidote or the poison wears off
Open wounds will cause you to lose blood. Use bandages to stop the bleeding immediately

Shows your internal injuries separately for the head, body, and limbs. These cannot be treated with potions, you will need to be treated by a qualified medic or attempt it yourself with special equipment. Head injuries cause penalties for accuracy, attack speed, and magic. Bodily injuries reduce endurance, and leg injuries reduce movement speed. Serious blood loss will lower your ability to inflict or resist damage
Your head is okay
Diagnosis: a few bruises, scratches, and a black eye - nothing to worry about
Diagnosis: a mild traumatic brain injury. May cause headaches, dizziness, and nausea. It`s hard to think straight, use magic or aim weapons. Consult your doctor at the first opportunity

Diagnosis: a severe skull and brain injury. Sight and hearing are impaired. Possible memory loss, hallucinations, and inadequate reaction to external stimuli. Your magic limit is decreased. Visit a doctor as soon as possible
You feel in good shape and ready to go
Diagnosis: a couple of bruises, burns, and cuts. Please, be more careful
Diagnosis: one or more ribs are broken, some inner organs are slightly damaged. Your stamina is decreased and it hurts to breathe. A good rest in bed is recommended
Diagnosis: multiple rib fractures, internal injuries, and spinal damage suspected. Danger of heart failure. A life threatening condition, immediate hospitalization is required
All four hooves look and feel alright
Diagnosis: a sprained ankle. Don`t step on this leg at least for a week

Diagnosis: at least one leg is broken, others have multiple minor injuries. You can not run and jump as usual in this condition. It is highly recommended mending the fractured bone, fix the broken leg and avoid any physical activities
Diagnosis: multiple open fractures, ankle ligament rupture, a knee shot. It is surprising that you can move at all in this condition. Immediately contact the nearest Ministry of Peace office
No blood loss
Diagnosis: you've lost some blood. A good rest and staying well fed will bring you back to normal
Diagnosis: you are suffering from severe blood loss. Possible muscle weakness, dizziness, loss of consciousness. A blood transfusion is recommended
Diagnosis: you are dying from blood loss. Take immediate action before it`s too late
Your magical reserves are full
You are tired a little, but your magical reserves are still okay
You need some magical restoration. Spells and telekinesis are starting to become weaker
You are nearing your limit for magic. Spells and telekinesis are considerably weakened. Avoid using any further magic to avoid magical burnout
Your magical power is depleted. You can hardly even lift small objects, let alone cast any spells
This value is subtracted from any damage you take (except from prolonged effects - for example, it doesn`t reduce damage from burning, bleeding, or poisoning)

The amount of physical damage you take is reduced by the armor level value, that is if bullet or melee weapon hit your armor. Affects only physical damage such as from bullets, melee weapons, blast damage etc. It depends on type and condition of the armor you wear. If condition drops below 50%, protection decreases

This value is subtracted from magical energy damage, if magical beam or projectile hit armor. Affects only magical damage such as fire, laser, plasma, lightning, or frost. Depends on type and condition of the armor you wear. If condition drops below 50%, protection decreases

This value shows how much body surface is covered by your armor. In fact, it is a probability that a strike or a projectile hits your armor, in which case damage will be reduced, or an uncovered body part. Depends on type and condition of the armor you wear. If condition drops below 50%, protection decreases

The higher this indicator is, the more often enemies with long-range weapons miss. The probability of hitting you is divided by the absolute value of evasion. For example, the "+ 20%" bonus means that the probability of hitting you is divided by 1.2
The higher this indicator is, the harder it is for enemies to see you, and the more time it will take them to discover you. Does not account for a StealthBuck effect
Only for external damage. Does not protect against health reduction resulting from poisoning, bleeding and other internal damage
Bonus to damage from any of your weapons and spells
Bonus to damage of melee weapons
Bonus to damage of combat spells
Bonus to damage of firearms and magical energy weapons
Suppresses health damage caused by venom in your body
Suppresses blood loss caused by open wounds
Reputation depends on the number of side quests you complete. Completing simple missions gives one point of reputation, more important, hard and dangerous ones give more
Paint sprays are used to paint on the walls. Hold Shift to use airbrush mode. Attention! All murals are temporary and disappear when you leave the room

Armor-piercing round has a special bullet with a hard core and a soft shell, designed to pierce armor. However, such bullets are less effective against unprotected targets and have a weaker stopping action

The expansive round has a bullet that deforms when it hits a soft environment, such as the victim`s body. Such bullets do more damage to unprotected targets, but at the same time they are very bad at penetrating armor, therefore are not effective against armored targets
In this ammo, 5 arrow-shaped bullets are used instead of the usual shot, good for penetrating armor but having a weaker stopping action
A cartridge that has a magically enchanted bullet that ignites the target on impact
A cartridge that allows exploiting magical energy technologies with common firearms. When hitting a target, the bullet from such a cartridge turns into a ball of plasma
A battery of increased power. Improves damage and gives weapons ability to burn armor, but a weapon wears out more quickly
Fuel with special additives that significantly increase the combustion temperature
A more powerful magical energy model of grenades
Grenade with a pulse charge, designed for fighting against robots

pip.String: You are below the recommended level for this area
Press to finish the quest and claim your reward

pip.Description: Toggle fullscreen mode
Disable hints
Disables all dialogue segments
Toggle damage popups
Total damage will be shown as a single number instead of multiple number popups
Disables most swearing by NPCs
Toggle default system cursor (Requires restart)
Toggle telekenesis hint popups
Show information about the assigned hotkeys when the cursor is at the bottom of the screen
Toggle error message windows

pip.String: [click] - select weapon@[right click] - in storage / take back@slot selection keys (@1- @2) - assign
[click] - put on armor@slot selection keys (@1- @2) - assign
[click] - use equipment@[right click] - discard (with [shift] - everything)@slot selection keys (@1- @2) - assign
[click] - put everything into storage@[right click] - pick everything from the storage
[click] - select 1 unit of product@[right click] - cancel selection@hold [shift] - select all
[click] - leave a weapon in storage or take it back
[click] - discard a spell or acquire it again
Attention! The medical module is damaged. Health monitoring functional is limited. Please visit a certified PipBuck technician for service
This merchant has nothing to sell
You have nothing valuable for sale

pip.Description:
Error 0-4570-7f45-a420-ff98 (System error, contact administrator)
The likely cause of the failure is an effect of an electromagnetic pulse on the PipBuck systems.
Checking the subsystems and modules:
• User Status - Not Available
• Medical module - not available
• Inventory sorter - not available
• Cartographic module - not available
• Targeting spell - not available
• User Interface - Disabled
• The operating system kernel - not responding
Attention! Reboot required
System reboot in progress, please wait .......

pip.String:
This is a list of all your weapons and magic. New weapons are indicated by the [☩] symbol.
Use [left mouse button] to equip the weapon. You can also use [mouse scroll] to change weapons in the game without opening inventory.
Use [right mouse button] to remove weapons you are not going to use from the list, or to add them back to the list.
Hover over a list item and press [slot selection key] ([1] - [0], [-], [=]) to assign a weapon to the quick access slot, or to cancel the assignment. By pressing the same key in the game, you can quickly equip this weapon.
You can also press the [slot selection key] together with the @1 key. Thus, the number of available slots increases from 12 to 24.
Hover over a grenade, mine, or attack spell and press @2 or @3 to designate them as additional weapons. Thus you will be able to use them together with the main weapon at any time using these keys. If no additional weapon is assigned, pressing the @4 key will use the last selected explosive, and the @5 key will activate the last selected combat spell.
In addition, you can assign a defensive spell to the quick spell slot using one of the [quick spell keys] (see control settings). By pressing the same key in game you can immediately apply the selected spell without having to equip it.
The right side of the screen shows weapon characteristics.
Damage: basic weapon damage (in parentheses is the actual damage that depends on your characteristics, in square brackets is the number of pellets for shotguns)
Damage per second: damage per second based on your characteristics (in brackets - approximate damage per second based on the time for reloading)
AP: action points for a shot at S.A.T.S. (in parentheses - the number of shots per burst shot in S.A.T.S. for automatic weapons)
Range: the distance in blocks at which the weapon will be guaranteed to hit the target. In reality this value is relative and depends on the weapon mastery skill and other factors

This is a list of your armor and amulets.
Use [left mouse button] to put on or take off your armor.
Hover over an item and press [slot selection key] ([1] - [0], [-], [=]) to assign the item to a quick access slot, or to cancel the assignment. By pressing the same key in game, you can quickly put on this armor, unless you are being attacked. You can also use the [slot selection key] together with the @1 key

This is a list of your equipment, which includes all items that you can use: protective spells, medicines, chemicals, potions, food, tools, books, spray cans.
Use [left mouse button] to apply an item or equip a protective spell if you have one (this spell can be used in game using the @2 key).
Hover over an item and press [slot selection key] ([1] - [0], [-], [=]) to assign this item to the quick access slot, or to cancel the assignment. By pressing the same key in game you can apply this item without opening inventory. You can also use the [slot selection key] together with the @1 key.
In addition, you can assign a protective spell to a quick spell slot using one of the [quick spell keys] (see control settings). By pressing the same key in the game, you can immediately apply the selected spell without having to equip it first.
New items are indicated by [☩]. Items which quantity has recently increased are indicated by the [+] symbol.

This is a list of all the other things you have, such as valuable items, artifacts, quest items, schematics, components and other junk. These things are either used automatically or are useless and can be sold to merchants

This is a list of all your ammunition and explosives. Ammunition suitable for the currently used weapon is located at the top of the list.
Use [left mouse button] to load the weapon with the necessary type of ammunition. You can also use [mouse scroll] along with the @1 key to change ammunition directly in game without opening inventory
In limited inventory mode, most items have weight. All your items are divided into categories, the weights for which are calculated separately

[Weapons]
You can take with you and use a limited number of weapons determined by the number of [weapon slots]. Knives and pistols occupy one cell, rifles, shotguns etc. - two, and large-sized weapons - three. Grenades and mines can be used without restrictions. All other weapons are only available at the base camp.
Use [right mouse click] to discard a specific weapon and free the slots it occupies. The weapon will be hidden, will not occupy the weapon slots and you won`t be able to use it. You can still find the same weapon on a mission, or you can take it back when you return to the base camp using PipBuck or the weapon stand.
You can carry more weapons than you have weapon slots for, but it will slow you down. With a slight overload you will not be able to run and dash, with more overload you will only be able to trot, and finally, you won`t be able to move at all. It will not affect movement speed in the base camp, but you won`t be able to go anywhere else until you reduce weight.
[Magic]
You can use a limited number of attacking or defensive spells, all others will be unavailable. Each spell occupies one [magic slot], otherwise the principle is the same as for weapons.
Each extra spell will reduce the magic recovery speed by 25%

[Armor]
You can take only one set of armor on a mission, the rest will remain in the base camp, except for protective suits and clothing. On a mission you can change into protective suits and clothing or back into the same armor any time.
Amulets can be changed at any time

[Equipment]
This includes valuable and fragile items that you may need at any time (even in battle), which is why the inventory sorter puts them in a separate bag: medicine, potions, battle chemicals, StealthBucks, repair kits, runes. Each item has an arbitrary [weight] characteristic, which shows the space it occupies in the inventory.
If you take more items than the bag can carry, they might break when you take damage or simply fall out of the bag.
[Ammunition]
This includes all rounds, batteries and explosives. Due to the dangerous nature of these items and the need for quick access to reload weapons, the inventory sorter puts them in ammo pouches. They cannot be mixed with other items.
[Stuff]
Most of the other contents of your bags are sorted to the "stuff" category. This includes everything that should not necessarily be close at hoof, regardless of commercial value: food and drinks, books, memory orbs, items for sale, weapon components, armor plates, potion ingredients. Drinks and food can be consumed at any time, but you will have to return to base camp to read books and view memory balls, as those activities require time and a safe place.
Ammunition and stuff taken above limit will slow you down just like weapons. Overloads from inventory items of different categories do stack.
[Miscellaneous]
All items which weight is not taken into account. Quest objects, keys, tools (like a screwdriver), PipBuck implants and modules, artifacts, schematics, spray cans. They don`t take inventory space and cannot be laid out or discarded

This is a world map, it displays all locations that you can visit. Locations can be of the following types:
[Base camps] - these are places where you don`t have to fight, instead you can trade, heal and take missions.
[Normal locations] - you can walk through and clear them once, enemies and items will not respawn in them. After completing the main objectives in such locations, they are marked as "completed". But you can return to them at any time to open the remaining containers or find secrets.
[Generated locations] can be passed and cleared many times in order to earn experience and collect valuable items. Each time you enter them, they will have new structures, enemies will respawn, and the containers will be untouched and full of various items. Also generated locations have special [trial rooms]. For completing the trials you will be rewarded with valuable items, and many [quest items] can also be found there.
Most generated locations have [levels]. At higher levels you will meet new interesting places, enemies and trials, as well as passages to new locations. To move to the next level, you must go to the end of the location and enter the door with the [Exit] sign. In most cases, you will have to go through at least 2 or 3 levels deep for advancing further in the story. Also, clearing at least 25% of enemies replenishes the assortment of goods available at merchants in base camps.
You can go to any available location from the base camp using the wall map or the map in your PipBuck. If you teleport to the base camp from a generated location, use [MAS terminal] for returning to the previous location. If you try returning through the map, the location will be generated anew.
Remember, if you save the game while being in a generated location, then after loading you will find yourself in the base camp! Its current configuration will be lost, only the maximum level of location reached and the completed trials are saved

You can save the game in slots (10 slots + autosave slot) or into a file.
Saving the game to a file can be used to create backup copies of your saves or to transfer saves between different versions of the game. To save to a file use the [To file] button on the [Save] tab, and for loading use the [From file] button on the [Load] tab and select file location and name.

[Attention! Important!]
Various disk cleanup programs might delete saves from slots! If you are using such a program, make a backup copy of the game save by using [To file] button.
It is also recommended that you save the game to a file periodically just in case

pip.Description: Click to choose which items should be picked up automatically
Automatically pick up new weapons if there are free slots for them
Automatically pick up a weapon if you have same weapon that needs repair
Automatically pick up any ammunition providing there is enough space in the "Ammunition" section
Automatically pick up ammunition that matches weapons you have with you providing there is enough space in the "Ammunition" section
Automatically pick up grenades, mines and bombs providing there is enough space in the "Ammunition" section
Automatically collect all potions and medications providing there is enough space in the "Equipment" section
Automatically collect all chemicals providing there is enough space in the "Equipment" section
Automatically collect StealthBucks, repair kits, runes and similar items providing there is enough space in the "Equipment" section
Automatically collect all non equipment or ammunition items providing there is enough space in the "Stuff" section
Gems, disks, pre-war books - all that can be sold to merchants
Educational books and memory orbs
Any food and beverages
Components for weapons, armor, explosives and electronic devices. Everything you need to work on a workbench
Alchemical ingredients, herbs, monster body parts. All that is useful for potions

pip.String: Leave some of the weapons at the weapon stand and put unnecessary items into the storage
You are overloaded with heavy items. In this state you will not be able to run and dash
You are heavily overloaded with items. In this state you may only trot and can barely jump
You are so overloaded with heavy stuff that you can`t make a single step

pip.Description: Affects reloading time of any weapon using ammo or batteries
Hit chance multiplier for any ranged weapon and attack spells
Hoof impact multiplier
Affects any melee weapon except those having their own motor (like a chain saw and auto axe)
The effectiveness of medications such as healing potions and RadAways
The general speed of movement. It can be affected with some factors such as freezing, concussion, alcohol intoxication or overburdening
Shows how much galloping is faster than trotting
Stamina consumption for running, jumping and dashing
Primarily determined by the "Lockpicking" skill, although some items and effects can also change this parameter
Primarily determined by the "Science" skill, but some items and effects can also change this parameter
Consumption of magic for all magical actions including telekinesis, attacking and defensive spells
Separate parameter for attacking spells only. It is multiplied with the "General magic consumption" parameter
The number of action points for attacks with any weapon in S.A.T.S.

Enabling this option will set the zoom to 100% at the beginning of the game. If left disabled, the scale will be set to fit the entire room on the screen.
Enable this option if your monitor has a resolution of FullHD (1920x1080) or more.
For lower resolution, disabling this option is recommended for reducing the load on the processor and improving performance.	
You can always change zoom in game using the @1 key. And if a room does not fit the entire screen, you can move the camera while holding @2
The camera will shake after explosions and strong blows
